newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves at intervention time.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves at intervention time.

text.p: The Federal Reserve was expected to add reserves into the banking system at its normal intervention time Wednesday via overnight system repurchase agreements (RP) or an eight-day fixed system RP, economists said.

"The Fed had $14.7 billion RPs in place yesterday to help meet the add need and offset pressures on overnight needs due to the refunding settlements, and an additional $1.125 billion was added by the settlement of the purchase of short coupons made last Friday," said Marc Wanshel, economist with Morgan Guaranty Trust Co.

He said Tuesday's add substantially exceeded the roughly $10 billion per day add need the Fed faced through the end of the settlement period, which should allow the Fed to replace the $10.1 billion overnight system RP arranged Tuesday with a much smaller operation this session.
"Our best bet today is an eight-day fixed RP in the $3 billion to $4 billion range," Wanshel said.
